A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It was ok. Not great. Not terrible. But ok. It is a Modern Disney Interpretation of a non Disney franchise. It feels different than the original trilogy. I discount the second trilogy as garbage. I can see why George Lucas would Cringe a bit at this. And I think about Walt Disney's creativity from the 50s and I see the entire Disney experience devolving into mass marketing\, political correctness and robotic happy faces. Like a Disney Channel movie. It's the same \"diverse\" casting and cute plastic animals\, CGI and light saber battles. I want to really like the characters like a heroic Han Solo or young Luke Skywalker. But the characters here are pretty Disneyfied. Anyway it's ok. Go see it. But I don't think any best actor academy awards will be had.
